availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Wirt Goddard (Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer and slaveholder.)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer. Scott County, Kentucky, native. Son of John Michael Goddard and Margaret McCleary Goddard. Married to Sarah Eliza Glave Goddard on January 29, 1857 in Harrison County, Kentucky. Father of Glave Goddard, Nicholas Goddard, Mary Goddard Curry, and Rebel Goddard. Farmer in Mercer County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Mercer County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 48.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 52A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Precinct 5, p. 515A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #000216888.
"William W Goddard (1820-1901)," Find A Grave, Memorial #15192381, accessed March 30, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/15192381.
